creator: tomasz.frelik@enzo.pl
text:
The version is actually 2.0.52.

The bug reveals itself only when running apache as a service. When running from 
the command line, it's OK with the very same settings.

The actual problem is this: I have PHP 4.3.9 in c:/bin/_php. php4apache2.dll has 
to be in the same directory. When it's in c:/bin/_php/sapi, or c:/bin/, apache 
service won't start, even though the directives in httpd.conf are correct:

# this one's OK
LoadModule php4_module c:\bin\_php\sapi\php4apache2.dll

# won't start, even though the file is there
LoadModule php4_module c:\bin\_php\php4apache2.dll

# won't start, even though the file is there
LoadModule php4_module c:\bin\php4apache2.dll

c:\bin and c:\bin\_php are in PATH, c:\bin\_php\sapi is not.

Every time the service fails to start, it logs 2 errors:

The Apache service named  reported the following error:
>>> Syntax error on line 122 of C:/usr/Apache2/conf/httpd.conf:     . 

The Apache service named  reported the following error:
>>> Cannot load C:/bin/_php/sapi/php4apache2.dll into server: Nie mo\xbfna 
odnale\x9f\xe6 okre\x9clonego modu\xb3u.     . 

The latter part of the second message is in polish, it means "cannot find the 
specified module".

creator: tomasz.frelik@enzo.pl
text:
I made a mistake. The snippet should read:
(...) even though the directives in httpd.conf are correct:

# this one's OK
LoadModule php4_module c:\bin\_php\php4apache2.dll

# won't start, even though the file is there (sapi/)
LoadModule php4_module c:\bin\_php\sapi\php4apache2.dll

# won't start, even though the file is there (../)
LoadModule php4_module c:\bin\php4apache2.dll

This sounds like a PHP bug. You should report it on http://bugs.php.net first.

Thanks for using Apache.
creator: chip@force-elite.com

text:
In fact it is probably a Windows "bug". I think this is a spurious error because
it can't find a DLL that php3apache2.dll depends on. If php4ts.dll is in the
same directory as php4apache2.dll (or in \windows\system32) then this error will
go away.
